item.title: Overwatch 2 is getting a Persona 5 crossover event alongside brand new hero
item.content:encoded:
Overwatch 2's eighteenth season launches next week and is bringing a Persona 5 crossover alongside a brand new hero.

The trailer for Season 18 ends with a tease of Joker from Atlus' beloved JRPG, who will likely appear as a skin for an existing hero. No further details are known at present, but hopefully more character skins and references will make their way into Blizzard's shooter.

The new hero joining this season is Wuyang, a Chinese "aquatic prodigy" who fights with a Xuanwu Staff and various water abilities as a support character.

Elsewhere, the biggest additions in Season 18 include:

  • Stadium Quick Play for shorter match times, along with Winston, Brigitte and Pharah joining Stadium at season launch (and Tracer mid-season)
  • A new stadium mode called Payload Race
  • A PvP refresh and perks update, with 50 new hero-specific perks, rebalanced options for certain heroes, and a full rank reset
  • Two new Mythics: one is a character skin offering four tiers of visual upgrades, the other is a weapon skin with flaming effects
  • A brand new battle pass full of cosmetics to unlock

More details can be found on the Overwatch 2 blog.

Season 18 of Overwatch 2 launches on 26th August.

This is a news-in-brief story. This is part of our vision to bring you all the big news as part of a daily live report.



https://www.eurogamer.net/overwatch-2-is-getting-a-persona-5-crossover-event-alongside-brand-new-hero

item.title: Hollow Knight Silksong will be supported with extra content for years to come
item.content:encoded:
Hollow Knight Silksong studio Team Cherry already has plans for DLC, with extra content planned in the months and years to come.

Yesterday, a release date was announced for the sequel after seven years in development. Co-founders Ari Gibson and William Pellen spoke to Bloomberg about creating Silksong, and what's coming next.

"Launching it is obviously quite exciting," said Pellen. "What comes after for us is equally as exciting."

"The most interesting thing now is what can we add to it next," added Gibson. "We got a plan. Admittedly, some of the plans for that stuff are kind of ambitious as well, but hopefully we can achieve some of it."

Despite its lengthy development, Silksong hasn't been in development hell. Instead, hype for the sequel snowballed, resulting in sales of the original game skyrocketing. In turn, this provided the financial freedom for Team Cherry to take its time.

Hollow Knight Silksong will be released on 4th September, across PC, Switch, PS5, and Xbox Series X/S (including Game Pass).

This is a news-in-brief story. This is part of our vision to bring you all the big news as part of a daily live report.



https://www.eurogamer.net/hollow-knight-silksong-will-be-supported-with-extra-content-for-years-to-come
